snippet: The choreographer Karole Armitage’s show offered performance pieces that used art and rock music, and ended with her stand-alone work “Rave.”
abstract: Gia Kourlas reviews dance program Werk]: The Armitage Gone Variety Show, performed by Armitage Gone] Dance company at Abrons Arts Center. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: In recent years Karole Armitage's dances have gone one of two ways: deep, resilient works that validate her keen grasp of technique and craft with an otherworldly, ineffable underpinning, or those that attach themselves to the surface of trend, supported by little more than the veneer of slick bodies. My preference is for her plush-evening-length dances -- the transcendent ''Time is the echo of an ax within a wood'' or her African dance-tinged ballet, ''Itutu.'' Alas, her latest evening, ''Werk!: The Armitage Gone Variety Show'' is of the bits-and-pieces persuasion.
